intro: Gilia violacea, commonly known as the violet gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Gilia violacea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
